official_title: To reinvigorate cooperation between the United States and Latin America in science and technology.

summary.text: Inter-American Scientific Cooperation Act of 1991 - Directs the National Science Foundation to establish the Inter-American Scientific Cooperation Program aimed at increasing science and technology cooperation between the United States and Latin America. Requires the Program to identify and cooperate with private and governmental funding bodies, which will bear a share of the financing of cooperative projects. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: To reinvigorate cooperation between the United States and Latin America in science and technology.
